page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO SURVEY AREA
page.content:
Our survey area is rural, predominently farmland used for pasture, crops other than grass and rough grazing. The main residential area is Dunton Bassett, where the local primary school is situated. Most of the houses are owner-occupied, detached and over 20 years' old. The area is served by three churches as a joint benefice based at Leire. There is little unemployment within the area, although few people work locally, most travelling to other centres of employment. The roads in the area are mainly country lanes linking the villages and farms. There is one major trunk road (A426) and a motorway (M1), both of which run North/South through our survey area.
{By CLASS 2 Dunton Bassett School.
